org.cytoscape.io.internal.cxio

Class CxImporter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.cytoscape.io.internal.cxio.CxImporter

  • public final class CxImporter
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is for de-serializing CX formatted networks, views, and attribute tables. In particular, it provides the following methods for writing CX:
    • getCxReader(AspectSet, InputStream)
    • readAsMap(AspectSet, InputStream)


    These methods use:
    • AspectSet to control which aspects to de-serialize



    Example using getCxReader(AspectSet, InputStream): 
     
 CxImporter cx_importer = CxImporter.createInstance();
 AspectSet aspects = new AspectSet();
 aspects.addAspect(Aspect.NODES);
 aspects.addAspect(Aspect.CARTESIAN_LAYOUT);
 aspects.addAspect(Aspect.EDGES);

 CxReader r = cx_importer.getCxReader(aspects, in);

 while (r.hasNext()) {
     List<AspectElement> elements = r.getNext();
     if (!elements.isEmpty()) {
         String aspect_name = elements.get(0).getAspectName();
         // Do something with "elements":
         for (AspectElement element : elements) {
             System.out.println(element.toString());
         }
     }
 }


    Example using readAsMap(AspectSet, InputStream): 
     
 CxImporter cx_importer = CxImporter.createInstance();
 AspectSet aspects = new AspectSet();
 aspects.addAspect(Aspect.NODES);
 aspects.addAspect(Aspect.CARTESIAN_LAYOUT);
 aspects.addAspect(Aspect.EDGES);

 SortedMap<String, List<AspectElement>> res = cx_importer.readAsMap(aspects, in);

      • getCxReader

        public final org.cxio.core.CxReader getCxReader(AspectSet aspects,
                                                java.io.InputStream in)
                                         throws java.io.IOException
        This is the primary method to parse a CX formatted input stream by returning a CxReader for a given InputStream and set of Aspects. The CxReader in turn is then used to obtain aspect fragments from the stream. Which aspects are de-serialized and which ones are ignored is controlled by the AspectSet argument.
        By way of example: 
         
 CxImporter cx_importer = CxImporter.createInstance();
 AspectSet aspects = new AspectSet();
 aspects.addAspect(Aspect.NODES);

 CxReader r = cx_importer.getCxReader(aspects, in);

 while (r.hasNext()) {
     List<AspectElement> elements = r.getNext();
     if (!elements.isEmpty()) {
         String aspect_name = elements.get(0).getAspectName();
         // Do something with "elements":
         for (AspectElement element : elements) {
             System.out.println(element.toString());
         }
     }
 }
        Parameters:
        aspects - the set of aspects to de-serialize
        in - a CX formatted input stream
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        See Also:
        cxio, AspectSet, Aspect

      • readAsMap

        public final java.util.SortedMap<java.lang.String,java.util.List<org.cxio.core.interfaces.AspectElement>> readAsMap(AspectSet aspects,
                                                                                                                    java.io.InputStream in)
                                                                                                             throws java.io.IOException
        This is a convenience method to parse a CX formatted input stream. It returns the aspect present in the input stream as a mapping of aspect names to lists of aspect elements. This convenience method is not recommended for very large data sets or if speed is of the essence.
        Parameters:
        aspects - the set of aspects to de-serialize
        in - a CX formatted input stream
        Returns:
        map of aspect names to lists of aspect elements
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        See Also:
        AspectSet, Aspect
